## Model.populate() method

Populates document references.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
populate<T extends Document>(this: Ctor<T>, docs: any[], options: PopulateOptions | PopulateOptions[], callback?: (err: any, res: T[]) => void): Promise<T[]>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  this | [Ctor](./goosetyped.ctor.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt; |  |
|  docs | any\[\] | Either a single document or array of documents to populate. |
|  options | PopulateOptions \| PopulateOptions\[\] | A hash of key/val (path, options) used for population. |
|  callback | (err: any, res: T\[\]) =&gt; void | Optional callback, executed upon completion. Receives err and the doc(s). |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;T\[\]&gt;
